main event: A man in Eastman, Georgia observed a bright, round object crossing the sky in a straight, parallel path at high speed.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the same size as the brighter stars in the Little Dipper constellation.
The object traveled from horizon to horizon in 5-10 seconds, much faster than a typical satellite.
The observer did not believe the object was a meteorite due to its parallel, level course.
The local weatherman reported that a satellite would likely be visible for around 15 minutes, but this object disappeared quickly.
The observer had no technical or scientific background.
